summary:
Software Engineer with several years of experience in different languages, like Java, Perl and C#. I'm exploring Typescript too. I have knowledge and experience with system design, I like testing, patterns...

Passionate about high tech and science.

certifications.name: Java EE: RESTful Service with JAX-RS 2.0

profile_positions.description:
I moved to a different area of the company, Core Infrastructure, to expand my knowledge about the technologies we use and the systems we have. At this moment I'm part of the Developers' Experience track where we create tools and systems to make others developers lives easier.

At this moment I'm one of the maintainers of our build system. I also develop services to help the company to be compliant with rules and regulations.

I keep mentoring developers in the company.

I will expand this information as my experience in this new area increases.
profile_positions.title: Senior Developer

profile_positions.description:
During my time as a Senior Developer I was also on trial to become a Lead Developer. The position included the guidance of other developer (including Seniors) and the collaboration with Principal Developers and Engineering Managers to determine the area strategy.

Here are some of my achievements during that period of time:

- Governance. Creation of guidelines to evaluate if the performance of migrations to our new web applications framework was in line with our expectations. These guidelines, based on historical data, gave clear limits to developers regarding performance and helped them to make the correct decisions while evaluating experiments. In addition to the creation of the guidelines I kept a close eye on every experiment for Extranet to check the performance impact. This helped my team to detect outliers, revisit the migration and fix it.
- Implementation of a system (in Java) to gather web vitals metrics. This system is currently in production and receives requests from different web applications, including our main website as well as others. It receives millions requests per day.
- Collaboration with other areas of the company to migrate our backend systems to kubernetes.
- Creation of a tool to generate Grafana dashboards automatically so our teams can have visibility of the behaviour of the systems they own.
- Maintenance of Extranet server-side rendering core functionality. I introduced performance improvements reducing the DB footprint by 75% and update operations by 99%. I also coordinated the works to solve a long outage that affected the system gathering important contributors together, organizing daily meetings, setting and evaluation hypotheses, testing and solving the issue.
- Mentoring of developers at different levels.
profile_positions.title: Lead Developer

profile_positions.description:
During my time as a Senior Developer I was involved in different fronts and collaborated  with different areas of the company. During part of my time in this position I was acting as a Lead Developer as part of my trial to move to that role. Here are some highlights of my time as a Senior Developer:

- Co-creation of a modern web stack for Extranet for modern web applications development. It was a big step and the first one towards the deprecation of Mason and the adoption of Vue.js pages. With this we also created a strong separation of concerns between the backend code and the frontend code, which was previously very entangled inside the Mason files.
- Dogfooding and refinement of the framework through page migrations before releasing it to a broader community.
- Improvements to the code resulting in a reduction of 2 seconds per call compared to the original version (called millions of times per day).
- Definition and documentation of the best practices for the framework usage.
- Main contact point for the migrations of other pages’ backend code.
- Performance improvements of the Extranet’s home page. The page suffered from a severe performance degradation with requests taking 15 seconds (and spikes of 25). I lowered the wall clock leaving it between 3.7 and 4.6 seconds. I achieved this without previous knowledge of performance improvements. I shared my new acquired knowledge and recommendations with the community and implemented alerts to notify the owners to reduce the possibility of this happening again.
- Support for the implementation of a self service system to allow our partners to manage users, including creation and rights configuration.
- I helped to change the culture in the company introducing code reviews in my area.
profile_positions.title: Senior Developer

profile_positions.description:
My main tasks were related to software development in Perl for Extranet, the platform used by Booking's accommodation partners. Some highlights:

- Vulnerabilities detection, patching and investigation to know the impact. I hit the ground running as I this did during my onboarding.
- Changes to the implementation of the Extranet multi-property home page  (landing page when you have more than 1 property) to use an asynchronous model. This reduced the total page load time by 40%. These changes also allowed accounts with a high number of properties to access Extranet, which was not possible for them before.
- Creation of the backend to allow Booking's partners to perform bulk operations on all their properties and increase their efficiency. From that moment our partners were able change a handful of properties or thousands of them at the same time through our website. Currently this implementation is still in use. Millions of changes have been made using it.
- Part of the GDPR team which helped the company to be compliant with personal identifiable information regulations.
- Migration of the backend reservations system, including the detection and fixes of bugs to measure the system SLOs.
profile_positions.title: Developer

profile_positions.description:
My main duties included the development of new features and software maintenance of the Ministry of Culture, Sports, Social Policy and Housing. The software I was in charge of was, mainly, the backend of an electronic procedure management system with more than 2 million documents which allowed the user to register and sign documents electronically and move them according to a defined workflow system. The system lets the users resolve more than 30.000 administrative procedures per year.

I was also involved in the development of a new platform for e-government where I was developing the workflow system to allow easy extension of the actions taken thanks to the employment of software design patterns.

All the systems were implemented in C#.NET and SQL as the main technologies. For my new developments I included unit testing using NUnit and Moq to ease code refactoring and bug detection when adding new features.

My side duties included the mentoring of fellow workers that developed front end interfaces, explaining them how to use HTML and CSS properly and lending a hand when they needed it.
profile_positions.title: Software Developer

profile_positions.description:
Web application developments of different nature which included the following projects:

-Development of a web application for procedure simplification tracking for the Telecommunications and New Technologies General Office. The application consisted of a JSF frontend and an EJB based backed. It allows the user to track the procedure simplification state and the generation of reports for single procedures and the whole simplification state.

-Migration of the Canary Islands Statistics Institute website to OpenCms. Migration from the old static contents to a Content Management System based on a JSP frontend and a Java backend (http://www.gobiernodecanarias.org/istac/).

-Customization of Moodle for a training sector enterprise located in Madrid. The project consisted, mainly, on the front end customization using CSS and fine tuning and some minor PHP modifications to group contents in a very specific way the client needed.

-Development of a web application for provisional booking training using ASP.NET and C#. The application allows a user to sing up in the system, search for available training a make provisional booking (http://www2.gobiernodecanarias.org/sanidad/essscan/altacurso.aspx).
profile_positions.title: Software Developer

company.name: Fundación Empresa Universidad de La Laguna

profile_positions.company: Fundación General de la Universidad de La Laguna
profile_positions.description:
Electronic file installation and usage training based on goal achievements.

Theoretical concepts and programming exercises for knowledge reinforcement and consolidation.

Materials and exercises for the course using JEE, JSF, Java, JBoss, Eclipse and JUnit.
profile_positions.title: Electronic File Instructor

company.name: Fundación Empresa Universidad de La Laguna and ACIISI

profile_positions.company: Fundación Empresa Universidad de La Laguna and ACIISI
profile_positions.description: Development of e-government web applications for funds requests. The applications allow the users to log into the system using a personal digital certificate to manage their funds request providing the necessary data and documents. The system running using JBoss was developed using Java Enterprise Edition, EJB for the backend and JSF for the frontend. In addition it was also integrated with and electronic document repository through the use of Apache CXF web service client and to the Canary Islands electronic government interoperability platform. My main tasks included the web service client integration, backend development and the HTML and CSS where I was the main reference. I also was in charge of our Linux server administration. All projects where developed using Scrum.
profile_positions.title: Software Developer

profile_positions.description:
I was in involved on the definition and development of information systems, using C#.NET and SQL Server for an overseas project for Angola. The project consisted on the development of clients and a multithreaded server including process synchronization, communication protocols, device programming, graphical user interfaces, data models and SQL Server implementation. The main purpose of the system was the control of the amounts of water consumption and the billing of it.

I also take part in a project related to GPS programming and acquisition with mobile devices and vector graphics representation of the resulting data.
profile_positions.title: Software Developer

profile_positions.description:
Review, correction, analysis and development of a billing application project using C++, Qt framework and XML. User interface, data model and peripherals. Software in production with zero bug report.

Technologies used: Linux, C++, XML, Qt framework, Qt Designer, qmake, Perl, PostgreSQL, etc.
profile_positions.title: Software Developer

profile_positions.description:
Installation, maintenance and administration of host computers, servers and network infrastructure. Help desk.

Windows Server with Active Directory and Linux systems.
